item.title: Grading
item.description: The grading will happen twice per year. Dan grading will be done once per year with the help of Stefan Stenudd. The grades will be Aikikai grades. Requirements/Techniques per Grade coming soon

item.title: Links
item.description: Aikido Enighet in Malmö Aikikai Hombu Dojo in Tokio

item.title: Contact
item.description: Email address We'll never share your email with anyone else. Subject Message Submit × Yes, the contact form works. I'll get an email, when you press Send. Please don't spam me!

item.title: Impressum
item.description: site author: Stephan Schroeder 55 St. Augustines Rd NW1 9RR London UK

item.title: Privacy Notice
item.description: No cookies, no tracking and no data is created/saved for future marketing. The contact message is send via AWS Lambda, but no data is retained (or even logs created), apart from the email in the dojos inbox, which is deleted after it has been answered.

item.title: Schedule & Address
item.description: × Site Under Construction! Adress and Schedule are only placeholder and not real! Adress Map tiles by Stamen Design, under CC BY 3.0. Data by OpenStreetMap, under ODbL. 42 Made Up Rd N0W ERE London Price first class is free x$ per week y$ per month Schedule Tuesday19:30-20:30 Thursday19:30-20:30 Saturday10:00-12:00 Opening Soon! Late 2019 or early 2020. If you have questions feel free to use the contact form

item.title: Advanced Techniques
item.description: High Fall/Roll Henka Waza - changing techniques Kaeshi Waza - counter techniques Centering Aiki - joining energies

item.title: Attacks in Aikido
item.description: Grab Attacks Strikes - attacker techniques Aikido against Punches Atemi - striking techniques

item.title: Basic Techniques
item.description: Ikkyo and Aiki Ken - sword applications The part with swords is admittedly not a basic technique anymore. But the technique - Ikkyo - is the first fundamental technique of Aikido. Nikkyo Sankyo Yonkyo Iriminage Shionage Kotegaeshi Tenchinage Kokyunage Kokyuho Ushiro - grips from behind Suwari Kokyuho

item.title: Weapons in Aikido
item.description: Tanto Dori - defence against knife Jo Dori - defence against staff Ken Suburi - basic solo sword exercises Aiki Ken - basic entering exercises Aikibatto - ten duo sword exercises

item.title: Teachers
item.description: Stephan Schroeder: 3rd Dan Aikikai started with Aikido in 2003 while still at university and never stopped. After finishing the university, he moved to Berlin where he continued his training in a dojo that was affiliated with Watanabe Nobuyuki, 8 Dan, (†2018) who's seminars Stephan visited for many years. The thing with Watanabe Sensei was that you probably didn't end up concrete answers but with very interesting questions.
